text: <@UCJANAW1Y> actually it does work, I though initial it would be replaced too but seems like the regex bypass it. Thanks ^^
<@U6GNQ7JBU> do you have any ETA for public release? I will send a few portals that have different issues related with the minifier/combinator

<@UJLMJNX6G> maybe these two are completely different scenarios. I'm trying to get an object property of type HubSpot User... maybe you are using your code to get data from the current user navigating the portal...?
Ah true. No I got what you mean. There were an other thread about this but the result was the same.
I'm still doing some testing for it and then planning on releasing it for all new CSS files
How can you get an object's property values with hubl?
Say for example you want to list all values from the property {contact.leadstatus}
what i'm looking at could be the hubl versi√≥n of Read a property api call
i don't believe you can read contact properties in Hubl. From my understanding (and someone can correct me if im wrong) is with the memberships, and you can only read that one contacts info at a time
<@U01C87PNTDE> what i'm trying to create is a dropdown based on a custom object's property options, like country ...

ahh, still, the only way that i know you would be able to do that is if you used HubDB to store those values and then read it into the page. This is because Hubl is not a true server side language and doesn't give you full access to the backend (i think its a security concern or something like that)
you could thing of hubl like twig or handlebars, its just some additional markup for templates
and HubSpot chose to not expose the majority of the properties to these templates

<@U01C87PNTDE> thanks for your response. I was trying to move away from HubDb to a Custom Objects solution (= even have the scaffolding for dynamic pages based on custom objects). But, yeah, I'm building my dropdowns from HubDB. I'm trying to imagine how nice it would be if you did not need to duplicate information (= the choices in a property def end up in a HubDB table or Column def).
the only other work around I could think of would be to make an AJAX call to a serverless function or external server  that interacts with the HS API to get a JSON object
